"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": create or delete pipelines
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": control build workers
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": change build trigger permissions and more. Due to the permissive access granted to a build environment administrator
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig2": it is highly recommended to keep the number of administrator accounts as minimal as possible."
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_2": "5.4 Restrict Administrator Privileges to Dedicated Administrator Accounts"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure build workers are single-used"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Use a clean instance of build worker for every pipeline run."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "Using a clean instance of build worker for every pipeline run eliminates the risks of data theft
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": data integrity breaches
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": and unavailability. It limits the pipeline's access to data stored on the file system from previous runs
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": and the cache is volatile. This prevents malicious changes from affecting other pipelines or the Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery system itself."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": "Data and cache will not be saved in different pipeline runs."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig3": "3.12 Segment Data Processing and Storage Based on Sensitivity"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure build worker environments and commands are passed and not pulled"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "A worker's environment can be passed (for example
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": a pod in a Kubernetes cluster in which an environment variable is passed to it). It also can be pulled
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": like a virtual machine that is installing a package. Ensure that the environment and commands are passed to the workers and not pulled from it."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": "Passing an environment means additional configuration happens in the build time phase and not in run time. It will also pass locally and not remotely. Passing a worker environment
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": instead of pulling it from an outer source
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": reduces the possibility for an attacker to gain access and potentially pull malicious code into it. By passing locally and not pulling from remote
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig2": there is also less chance of an attack based on the remote connection
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig3": such as a man-in-the-middle or malicious scripts that can run from remote. This therefore prevents possible infection of the build worker."
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_3": "16.1 Establish and Maintain a Secure Application Development Process"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure the duties of each build worker are segregated"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Separate responsibilities in the build workflow
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": such as testing
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": compiling
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": pushing artifacts
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": etc.
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": to different build workers so that each worker will have a single duty."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig2": "Separating duties and allocating them to many workers makes it easier to verify each step in the build process and ensure there is no corruption. It also limits the effect of an attack on a build worker
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig3": as such an attack would be less critical if the worker has less access and duties that are subject to harm."
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_3": "16.1 Establish and Maintain a Secure Application Development Process"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure build workers have minimal network connectivity"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Ensure that build workers have minimal network connectivity."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "Restricting the network connectivity of build workers decreases the possibility that an attacker would be capable of entering the organization from the outside. If the build workers are connected to the public internet without any restriction
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": it is far simpler for attackers to compromise them. Limiting network connectivity between build workers also protects the organization in case an attacker was successful and subsequently attempts to spread the attack to other components of the environment."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": "Developers will not have connectivity to every resource they might need from the outside. Workers will also only be able to exchange data through shareable storage."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": "Build Pipelines"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": "13.5 Manage Access Control for Remote Assets"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure run-time security is enforced for build workers"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Add traces to build workers' operating systems and installed applications so that in run time
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": collected events can be analyzed to detect suspicious behavior patterns and malware."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": "Build workers are exposed to data exfiltration attacks
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": code injection attacks
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": and more while running. It is important to secure them from such attacks by enforcing run-time security on the build worker itself. This will identify attempted attacks in real time and prevent them."

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure build workers are automatically scanned for vulnerabilities"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Scan build workers for vulnerabilities. It is recommended that this be done automatically."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "Automatic scanning for vulnerabilities detects known weaknesses in environmental sources in use
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": such as docker images or kernel versions. Such vulnerabilities can lead to a massive breach if these environments are not replaced as fast as possible
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": since attackers also know about these vulnerabilities and often try to take advantage of them. Setting automatic scanning which scans environmental sources ensures that if any new vulnerability is revealed
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": it can be replaced quickly and easily. This protects the worker from being exposed to attacks."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig3": "7.5 Perform Automated Vulnerability Scans of Internal Enterprise Assets"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure build workers' deployment configuration is stored in a version control platform"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Store the deployment configuration of build workers in a version control platform
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": such as Github."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": "Build workers are a sensitive part of the build phase. They generally have access to the code repository
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": the Continuous Integration platform
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": the deployment platform
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": etc. This means that an attacker gaining access to a build worker may compromise other platforms in the organization and cause a major incident. One thing that can protect workers is to ensure that their deployment configuration is safe and well-configured. Storing the deployment configuration in version control enables more observability of these configurations because everything is catalogued in a single place. It adds another layer of security
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig2": as every change will be reviewed and noticed
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig3": and thus malicious changes will theoretically occur less. In the case of a mistake
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_3": it also offers an easier way to 'revert' back to a safe version or add a 'hot fix' quickly."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.document.name": "Changes in deployment configuration may only be applied by declaration in the version control platform. This could potentially slow down the development process."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.document.date": "4.1 Establish and Maintain a Secure Configuration Process"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure resource consumption of build workers is monitored"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Monitor the resource consumption of build workers and set alerts for high consumption that can lead to resource exhaustion."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "Resource exhaustion is when machine resources or services are highly consumed until exhausted. Resource exhaustion may lead to DOS (Denial of Service). When such a situation happens to build workers
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": it slows down and even stops the build process
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": which harms the production of artifacts and the organization's ability to deliver software on schedule. To prevent that
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": it is recommended to monitor resources consumption in the build workers and set alerts to notify when they are highly consumed. That way resource exhaustion can be acknowledged and prevented at an early stage."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig3": "7.5 Perform Automated Vulnerability Scans of Internal Enterprise Assets"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure all build steps are defined as code"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Use pipeline as code for build pipelines and their defined steps."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "Storing pipeline instructions as code in a version control system means automation of the build steps and less room for human error
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": which could potentially lead to a security breach. Additionally
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": It creates the ability to revert back to a previous pipeline configuration in order to pinpoint the affected change should a malicious incident occur."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": "Build Pipelines"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig2": "4.6 Securely Manage Enterprise Assets and Software"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure steps have clearly defined build stage input and output"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Define clear expected input and output for each build stage."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "In order to have more control over data flow in the build pipeline
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": clearly define the input and output of the pipeline steps. If anything malicious happens during the build stage
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": it will be recognized more easily and stand out as an anomaly."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": "Build Pipelines"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig2": "16.1 Establish and Maintain a Secure Application Development Process"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure output is written to a separate
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "Write pipeline output artifacts to a secured storage repository."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": "To maintain output artifacts securely and reduce the potential surface for attack
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": store such artifacts separately in secure storage. This separation enforces the Single Responsibility Principle by ensuring the orchestration platform will not be the same as the artifact storage
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": which reduces the potential harm of an attack. Using the same security considerations as the input (for example
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": the source code) will protect artifacts stored and will make it harder for a malicious actor to successfully execute an attack."
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_1": "3.12 Segment Data Processing and Storage Based on Sensitivity"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure changes to pipeline files are tracked and reviewed"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Track and review changes to pipeline files."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "Pipeline files are sensitive files. They have the ability to access sensitive data and control the build process
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": thus it is just as important to review changes to pipeline files as it is to verify source code. Malicious actors can potentially add harmful code to these files
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": which may lead to sensitive data exposure and hijacking of the build environment or artifacts."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": "Build Pipelines"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure access to build process triggering is minimized"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Restrict access to pipeline triggers."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "Build pipelines are used for multiple reasons. Some are very sensitive
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": such as pipelines which deploy to production. In order to protect the environment from malicious acts or human mistakes
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": such as a developer deploying a bug to production
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": it is important to apply the Least Privilege principle to pipeline triggering. This principle requires restrictions placed on which users can run which pipeline. It allows for sensitive pipelines to only be run by administrators
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": who are generally the most trusted and skilled members of the organization."

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure pipelines are automatically scanned for misconfigurations"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Scan the pipeline for misconfigurations. It is recommended that this be performed automatically."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "Automatic scans for misconfigurations detect human mistakes and misconfigured tasks. This protects the environment from backdoors caused by such mistakes
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": which create easier access for attackers. For example
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": a task that mistakenly configures credentials to persist on the disk makes it easier for an attacker to steal them. This type of incident can be prevented by auto-scanning."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": "Build Pipelines"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig2": "7.5 Perform Automated Vulnerability Scans of Internal Enterprise Assets"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure pipelines are automatically scanned for vulnerabilities"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Scan pipelines for vulnerabilities. It is recommended that this be implemented automatically."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "Automatic scanning for vulnerabilities detects known vulnerabilities in pipeline instructions and components
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": allowing faster patching in case one is found. These vulnerabilities can lead to a potentially massive breach if not handled as fast as possible
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": as attackers might also be aware of such vulnerabilities."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": "Build Pipelines"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig2": "7.5 Perform Automated Vulnerability Scans of Internal Enterprise Assets"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure scanners are in place to identify and prevent sensitive data in pipeline files"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Detect and prevent sensitive data
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": such as confidential ID numbers
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": passwords
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": etc.
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": in pipelines."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": "Sensitive data in pipeline configuration
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig2": such as cloud provider credentials or repository credentials
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig3": create vulnerabilities with which malicious actors could steal such information if they gain access to a pipeline. In order to mitigate this
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_1": set scanners that will identify and prevent the existence of sensitive data in the pipeline."

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure all artifacts on all releases are signed"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Sign all artifacts in all releases with user or organization keys."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "Signing artifacts is used to validate both their integrity and security. Organizations signal that artifacts may be trusted and they themselves produced them by ensuring that every artifact is properly signed. The presence of this signature also makes potentially malicious activity far more difficult."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": "Build Pipelines"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": "18.4 Validate Security Measures"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": "FALSE"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure all external dependencies used in the build process are locked"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "External dependencies may be public packages needed in the pipeline
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": or perhaps the public image being used for the build worker. Lock these external dependencies in every build pipeline."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": "External dependencies are sources of code that aren't under organizational control. They might be intentionally or unintentionally infected with malicious code or have known vulnerabilities
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": which could result in sensitive data exposure
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": data harvesting
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": or the erosion of trust in an organization. Locking each external dependency to a specific
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig2": safe version gives more control and less chance for risk."
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_2": "7.6 Perform Automated Vulnerability Scans of Externally-Exposed Enterprise Assets"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure dependencies are validated before being used"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Validate every dependency of the pipeline before use."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "To ensure that a dependency used in a pipeline is trusted and has not been infected by malicious actor (for example
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": the codecov incident)
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": validate dependencies before using them. This can be accomplished by comparing the checksum of the dependency to its checksum in a trusted source. If a difference arises
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": this is a sign that an unknown actor has interfered and may have added malevolent code. If this dependency is used
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": it will infect the environment
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig2": which could end in a massive breach and leave the organization exposed to data leaks
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_3": "16.2 Establish and Maintain a Process to Accept and Address Software Vulnerabilities"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure the build pipeline creates reproducible artifacts"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Verify that the build pipeline creates reproducible artifacts
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": meaning that an artifact of the build pipeline is the same in every run when given the same input."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": "A reproducible build is a build that produces the same artifact when given the same input data. Ensuring that the build pipeline produces the same artifact when given the same input helps verify that no change has been made to the artifact. This action allows an organization to trust that its artifacts are built only from safe code that has been reviewed and tested and has not been tainted or changed abruptly."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": "Build Pipelines"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": "16.1 Establish and Maintain a Secure Application Development Process"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure pipeline steps produce a Software Bill of Materials (SBOM)"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "SBOM (Software Bill of Materials) is a file that specifies each component of software or a build process. Generate an SBOM after each run of a pipeline."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "Generating a Software Bill of Materials after each run of a pipeline will validate the integrity and security of that pipeline. Recording every step or component role in the pipeline ensures that no malicious acts have been committed during the pipeline's run."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": "Build Pipelines"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": "16.1 Establish and Maintain a Secure Application Development Process"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": "FALSE"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure pipeline steps sign the Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) produced"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "SBOM (Software Bill of Materials) is a file that specifies each component of software or a build process. It should be generated after every pipeline run. After it is generated
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": it must then be signed."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": "Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) is a file used to validate the integrity and security of a build pipeline. Signing it ensures that no one tampered with the file when it was delivered. Such interference can happen if someone tries to hide unusual activity. Validating the SBOM signature can detect this activity and prevent much greater incident."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": "Build Pipelines"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": "16.1 Establish and Maintain a Secure Application Development Process"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure third-party artifacts and open-source libraries are verified"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Ensure third-party artifacts and open-source libraries in use are trusted and verified."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "Verify third-party artifacts used in code are trusted and have not been infected by a malicious actor before use. This can be accomplished
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": for example
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": by comparing the checksum of the dependency to its checksum in a trusted source. If a difference arises
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": this may be a sign that someone interfered and added malicious code. If this dependency is used
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": it will infect the environment and could end in a massive breach
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig2": leaving the organization exposed to data leaks and more."

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) is required from all third-party suppliers"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "A Software Bill Of Materials (SBOM) is a file that specifies each component of software or a build process. Require an SBOM from every third-party provider."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "A Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) for every third-party artifact helps to ensure an artifact is safe to use and fully compliant. This file lists all important metadata
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": especially all the dependencies of an artifact
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": and allows for verification of each dependency. If one of the dependencies/artifacts are attacked or has a new vulnerability (for example
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": the 'SolarWinds' or even 'log4j' attacks)
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": it is easier to detect what has been affected by this incident because dependencies in use are listed in the SBOM file."
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_1": "2.1 Establish and Maintain a Software Inventory
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_2": 16.5 Use Up-to-Date and Trusted Third-Party Software Components"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure signed metadata of the build process is required and verified"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Require and verify signed metadata of the build process for all dependencies in use."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "The metadata of a build process lists every action that took place during an artifact build. It is used to ensure that an artifact has not been compromised during the build
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": that no malicious code was injected into it
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": and that no nefarious dependencies were added during the build phase. This creates trust between user and vendor that the software supplied is exactly the software that was promised. Signing this metadata adds a checksum to ensure there have been no revisions since its creation
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": as this checksum changes when the metadata is altered. Verification of proper metadata signature with Certificate Authority confirms that the signature was produced by a trusted entity."

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure dependencies are monitored between open-source components"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Monitor
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": or ask software suppliers to monitor
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": dependencies between open-source components in use."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": "Monitoring dependencies between open-source components helps to detect if software has fallen victim to attack on a common open-source component. Swift detection can aid in quick application of a fix. It also helps find potential compliance problems with components usage. Some dependencies might not be compatible with the organization's policies
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": and other dependencies might have a license that is not compatible with how the organization uses this specific dependency. If dependencies are monitored
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": such situations can be detected and mitigated sooner

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure trusted package managers and repositories are defined and prioritized"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Prioritize trusted package registries over others when pulling a package."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "When pulling a package by name
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": the package manager might look for it in several package registries
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": some of which may be untrusted or badly configured. If the package is pulled from such a registry
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": there is a higher likelihood that it could prove malicious. In order to avoid this
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": configure packages to be pulled from trusted package registries."

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure a signed Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) of the code is supplied"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "A Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) is a file that specifies each component of software or a build process. When using a dependency
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": demand its SBOM and ensure it is signed for validation purposes."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": "A Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) creates trust between its provider and its users by ensuring that the software supplied is the software described
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": without any potential interference in between. Signing an SBOM creates a checksum for it
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": which will change if the SBOM's content was changed. With that checksum
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": a software user can be certain nothing had happened to it during the supply chain
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig2": engendering trust in the software. When there is no such trust in the software
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig3": the risk surface is increased because one cannot know if the software is potentially vulnerable. Demanding a signed SBOM and validating it decreases that risk."
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_3": "2.1 Establish and Maintain a Software Inventory
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.document.name": 2.2 Ensure Authorized Software is Currently Supported"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure dependencies are pinned to a specific
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "Pin dependencies to a specific version. Avoid using the 'latest' tag or broad version."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": "When using a wildcard version of a package
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": or the 'latest' tag
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": the risk of encountering a new
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": potentially malicious package increases. The 'latest' tag pulls the last package pushed to the registry. This means that if an attacker pushes a new
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig2": malicious package successfully to the registry
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig3": the next user who pulls the 'latest' will pull it and risk attack. This same rule applies to a wildcard version- assuming one is using version v1.*
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_1": it will install the latest version of the major version 1
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_2": meaning that if an attacker can push a malicious package with that same version
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_3": those using it will be subject to possible attack. By using a secure
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.document.version": use is restricted to this version only and no other may be pulled
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.document.date": decreasing the risk for any malicious package."
"ssphp.metadata.last_updated_date": "2.1 Establish and Maintain a Software Inventory

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure all packages used are more than 60 days old"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Use packages that are more than 60 days old."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "Third-party packages are a major risk since an organization cannot control their source code
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": and there is always the possibility these packages could be malicious. It is therefore good practice to remain cautious with any third-party or open-source package
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": especially new ones
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": until they can be verified that they are safe to use. Avoiding a new package allows the organization to fully examine it
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": its maintainer
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig3": and gives enough time to determine whether or not to use it."
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_1": "Developers may not use packages that are less than 60 days old."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.document.date": 16.5 Use Up-to-Date and Trusted Third-Party Software Components"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure an organization-wide dependency usage policy is enforced"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Enforce a policy for dependency usage across the organization. For example
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": disallow the use of packages less than 60 days old."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": "Enforcing a policy for dependency usage in an organization helps to manage dependencies across the organization and ensure that all usage is compliant with security policy. If
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": for example
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": the policy limits the package managers that can be used
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": enforcing it will make sure that every dependency is installed only from these package managers
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig2": and limit the risk of installing from any untrusted source."
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_2": "16.1 Establish and Maintain a Secure Application Development Process"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure packages are automatically scanned for known vulnerabilities"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Automatically scan every package for vulnerabilities."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "Automatic scanning for vulnerabilities detects known vulnerabilities in packages and dependencies in use
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": allowing faster patching when one is found. Such vulnerabilities can lead to a massive breach if not handled as fast as possible
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": as attackers will also know about those vulnerabilities and swiftly try to take advantage of them. Scanning packages regularly for vulnerabilities can also verify usage compliance with the organization's security policy."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": "Dependencies"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig2": "7.5 Perform Automated Vulnerability Scans of Internal Enterprise Assets
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig3": 7.6 Perform Automated Vulnerability Scans of Externally-Exposed Enterprise Assets"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure packages are automatically scanned for license implications"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "A software license is a document that provides legal conditions and guidelines for the use and distribution of software
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": usually defined by the author. It is recommended to scan for any legal implications automatically."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": "When using packages with software licenses
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": especially commercial ones which tend to be the strictest
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": it is important to verify that the use of the package meets the conditions of the license. If the use of the package violates the licensing agreement
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": it exposes the organization to possible lawsuits. Scanning used packages for such license implications leads to faster detection and quicker fixes of such violations
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig2": and also reduces the risk for a lawsuit."
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_2": "7.5 Perform Automated Vulnerability Scans of Internal Enterprise Assets
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_3": 7.6 Perform Automated Vulnerability Scans of Externally-Exposed Enterprise Assets"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure packages are automatically scanned for ownership change"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Scan every package automatically for ownership change."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "A change in package ownership is not a regular action. In some cases it can lead to a massive problem (for example
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": the 'event-stream' incident). Open-source contributors are not always trusted
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": since by its very nature everyone can contribute. This means malicious actors can become contributors as well. Package maintainers might transfer their ownership to someone they do not know if maintaining the package is too much for them
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": in some cases without the other user's knowledge. This has led to known security breaches in the past. It is best to be aware of such activity as soon as it happens and to carefully examine the situation before continuing using the package in order to determine its safety."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig3": "7.5 Perform Automated Vulnerability Scans of Internal Enterprise Assets
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_1": 7.6 Perform Automated Vulnerability Scans of Externally-Exposed Enterprise Assets"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure all artifacts are signed by the build pipeline itself"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Configure the build pipeline to sign every artifact it produces and verify that each artifact has the appropriate signature."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "A cryptographic signature can be used to verify artifact authenticity. The signature created with a certain key is unique and not reversible
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": thus making it unique to the author. This means that an attacker tampering with a signed artifact will be noticed immediately using a simple verification step because the signature will change. Signing artifacts by the build pipeline that produces them ensures the integrity of those artifacts."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": "Artifacts"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": "16.7 Use Standard Hardening Configuration Templates for Application Infrastructure"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure artifacts are encrypted before distribution"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Encrypt artifacts before they are distributed and ensure only trusted platforms have decryption capabilities."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "Build artifacts might contain sensitive data such as production configurations. In order to protect them and decrease the risk for breach
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": it is recommended to encrypt them before delivery. Encryption makes data unreadable
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": so even if attackers gain access to these artifacts
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": they won't be able to harvest sensitive data from them without the decryption key."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig3": "16.7 Use Standard Hardening Configuration Templates for Application Infrastructure"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure only authorized platforms have decryption capabilities of artifacts"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Grant decryption capabilities of artifacts only to trusted and authorized platforms."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "Build artifacts might contain sensitive data such as production configuration. To protect them and decrease the risk of a breach
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": it is recommended to encrypt them before delivery. This will make them unreadable for every unauthorized user who doesn't have the decryption key. By implementing this
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": the decryption capabilities become overly sensitive in order to prevent a data leak or theft. Ensuring that only trusted and authorized platforms can decrypt the organization's packages decreases the possibility for an attacker to gain access to the critical data in artifacts."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": "Artifacts"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure the authority to certify artifacts is limited"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Software certification is used to verify the safety of certain software usage and to establish trust between the supplier and the consumer. Any artifact can be certified. Limit the authority to certify different artifacts."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "Artifact certification is a powerful tool in establishing trust. Clients use a software certificate to verify that the artifact is safe to use according to their security policies. Because of this
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": certifying artifacts is considered sensitive. If an artifact is for debugging or internal use
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": or if it were compromised
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": the organization would not want certification. An attacker gaining access to both certificate authority and the artifact registry might also be able to certify its own artifact and cause a major breach. To prevent these issues
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": limit which artifacts can be certified by which platform so there will be minimal access to certification."
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_1": "16.2 Establish and Maintain a Process to Accept and Address Software Vulnerabilities"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure number of permitted users who may upload new artifacts is minimized"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Minimize ability to upload artifacts to the lowest number of trusted users possible."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "Artifacts might contain sensitive data. Even the simplest mistake can also lead to trust issues with customers and harm the integrity of the product. To decrease these risks
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": allow only trusted and qualified users to upload new artifacts. Those users are less likely to make mistakes. Having the lowest number of such users possible will also decrease the risk of hacked user accounts
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": which could lead to a massive breach or artifact compromising."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": "Artifacts"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure user access to the package registry utilizes Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Enforce Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for user access to the package registry."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "By default
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": every user authenticates to the system by password only. If a user's password is compromised
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": the user account and all its related packages are in danger of data theft and malicious builds. It is therefore recommended that each user enables Multi-Factor Authentication. This additional step guarantees that the account stays secure even if the user's password is compromised
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": as it adds another layer of authentication."

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure user management of the package registry is not local"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Manage users and their access to the package registry with an external authentication server and not with the package registry itself."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "Some package registries offer a tool for user management
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": aside from the main Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) or Active Directory (AD) server of the organization. That tool usually offers simple authentication and role-based permissions
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": which might not be granular enough. Having multiple user management tools in the organization could result in confusion and privilege escalation
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": as there will be more to manage. To avoid a situation where users escalate their privileges because someone missed them
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": manage user access to the package registry via the main authentication server and not locally on the package registry."

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure anonymous access to artifacts is revoked"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "For GitHub Private or Internal repositories anonymous access is not available. Verify that all repos that require access controls are Private or Internal."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "Disable the option to view artifacts as an anonymous user in order to protect private artifacts from being exposed."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": "Only logged and authorized users will be able to access artifacts."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": "Artifacts"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": "2.5 Allowlist Authorized Software
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": 2.6 Allowlist Authorized Libraries"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure minimum number of administrators are set for the package registry"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Ensure the package registry has a minimum number of administrators."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "Package registry admins have the ability to add/remove users
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": repositories
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": packages. Due to the permissive access granted to an admin
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": it is highly recommended to keep the number of administrator accounts as minimal as possible."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": "Administrator privileges are required to provide and maintain a secure and stable platform but allowing extraneous administrator accounts can create a vulnerability."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig3": "5.4 Restrict Administrator Privileges to Dedicated Administrator Accounts"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure all signed artifacts are validated upon uploading the package registry"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Validate artifact signatures before uploading to the package registry."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "Cryptographic signature is a tool to verify artifact authenticity. Every artifact is supposed to be signed by its creator in order to confirm that it was not compromised before reaching the client. Validating an artifact signature before delivering it is another level of protection which ensures the signature has not been changed
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": meaning no one tried or succeeded in tampering with the artifact. This creates trust between the supplier and the client."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": "Artifacts"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": "7.5 Perform Automated Vulnerability Scans of Internal Enterprise Assets
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig2": 7.6 Perform Automated Vulnerability Scans of Externally-Exposed Enterprise Assets"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure all versions of an existing artifact have their signatures validated"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Validate the signature of all versions of an existing artifact."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "In order to be certain a version of an existing and trusted artifact is not malicious or delivered by someone looking to interfere with the supply chain
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": it is a good practice to validate the signatures of each version. Doing so decreases the risk of using a compromised artifact
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": which might lead to a breach."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": "Artifacts"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig2": "7.5 Perform Automated Vulnerability Scans of Internal Enterprise Assets
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig3": 7.6 Perform Automated Vulnerability Scans of Externally-Exposed Enterprise Assets"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure changes in package registry configuration are audited"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Audit changes of the package registry configuration."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "The package registry is a crucial component in the software supply chain. It stores artifacts with potentially sensitive data that will eventually be deployed and used in production. Every change made to the package registry configuration must be examined carefully to ensure no exposure of the registry's sensitive data. This examination also ensures no malicious actors have performed modifications to a stored artifact. Auditing the configuration and its changes helps in decreasing such risks."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": "Artifacts"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": "8.5 Collect Detailed Audit Logs"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": "FALSE"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure webhooks of the repository are secured"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Use secured webhooks to reduce the possibility of malicious payloads."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "Webhooks are used for triggering an HTTP request based on an action made in the platform. Typically
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": package registries feature webhooks when a package receives an update. Since webhooks are an HTTP POST request
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": they can be malformed if not secured over SSL. To prevent a potential hack and compromise of the webhook or to the registry or web server excepting the request
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": use only secured webhooks."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": "Reduces the payloads that the web hook can listen for and recieve."

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure artifacts contain information about their origin"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "When delivering artifacts
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": ensure they have information about their origin. This may be done by providing a Software Bill of Manufacture (SBOM) or some metadata files."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": "Information about artifact origin can be used for verification purposes. Having this kind of information allows the user to decide if the organization supplying the artifact is trusted. In a case of potential vulnerability or version update
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": this can be used to verify that the organization issuing it is the actual origin and not someone else. If users need to report problems with the artifact
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": they will have an address to contact as well."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig3": "1.1 Establish and Maintain Detailed Enterprise Asset Inventory"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure deployment configuration files are separated from source code"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Deployment configurations are often stored in a version control system. Separate deployment configuration files from source code repositories."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "Deployment configuration manifests are often stored in version control systems. Storing them in dedicated repositories
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": separately from source code repositories
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": has several benefits. First
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": it adds order to both maintenance and version control history. This makes it easier to track code or manifest changes
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": as well as spot any malicious code or misconfigurations. Second
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig2": it helps achieve the Least Privilege principle. Because access can be configured differently for each repository
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig3": fewer users will have access to this configuration
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.document.name": "16.1 Establish and Maintain a Secure Application Development Process"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure changes in deployment configuration are audited"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Audit and track changes made in deployment configuration."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "Deployment configuration is sensitive in nature. The tiniest mistake can lead to downtime or bugs in production
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": which consequently may have a direct effect on both product integrity and customer trust. Misconfigurations might also be used by malicious actors to attack the production platform. Because of this
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": every change in the configuration needs a review and possible 'revert' in case of a mistake or malicious change. Auditing every change and tracking them helps detect and fix such incidents more quickly."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": "Deployment"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure scanners are in place to identify and prevent sensitive data in deployment configuration"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Detect and prevent sensitive data - such as confidential ID numbers
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": passwords
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": etc. - in deployment configurations."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": "Sensitive data in deployment configurations might create a major incident if an attacker gains access to it
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": as this can cause data loss and theft. It is important to keep sensitive data safe and to not expose it in the configuration. In order to prevent a possible exposure
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": set scanners that will identify and prevent such data in deployment configurations."

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Limit access to deployment configurations"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Restrict access to the deployment configuration to trusted and qualified users only."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "Deployment configurations are sensitive in nature. The tiniest mistake can lead to downtime or bugs in production
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": which can have a direct effect on the product's integrity and customer trust. Misconfigurations might also be used by malicious actors to attack the production platform. To avoid such harm as much as possible
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": ensure only trusted and qualified users have access to such configurations. This will also reduce the number of accounts that might affect the environment in case of an attack."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": "Reducing the number of users who have access to the deployment configuration means those users would lose their ability to make direct changes to that configuration."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": "Deployment"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig3": 6.8 Define and Maintain Role-Based Access Control"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Scan Infrastructure as Code (IaC)"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Detect and prevent misconfigurations or insecure instructions in Infrastructure as Code (IaC) files
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": such as Terraform files."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": "Infrastructure as Code (IaC) files are used for production environment and application deployment. These are sensitive parts of the software supply chain because they are always in touch with customers
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": and thus might affect their opinion of or trust in the product. Attackers often target these environments. Detecting and fixing misconfigurations and/or insecure instructions in IaC files decreases the risk for data leak or data theft. It is important to secure IaC instructions in order to prevent further problems of deployment
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": exposed assets
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": or improper configurations
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig2": which might ultimately lead to easier ways to attack and steal organization data."
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_2": "7.5 Perform Automated Vulnerability Scans of Internal Enterprise Assets"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure deployment configuration manifests are verified"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Verify the deployment configuration manifests."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "To ensure that the configuration manifests used are trusted and have not been infected by malicious actors before arriving at the platform
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": it is important to verify the manifests. This may be done by comparing the checksum of the manifest file to its checksum in a trusted source. If a difference arises
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": this is a sign that an unknown actor has interfered and may have added malicious instructions. If this manifest is used
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": it might harm the environment and application deployment
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": which could end in a massive breach and leave the organization exposed to data leaks
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_2": "4.1 Establish and Maintain a Secure Configuration Process"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure deployment configuration manifests are pinned to a specific
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "Deployment configuration is often stored in a version control system and is pulled from there. Pin the configuration used to a specific
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": verified version or commit Secure Hash Algorithm (SHA). Avoid referring configuration without its version tag specified."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": "Deployment configuration manifests are often stored in version control systems and pulled from there either by automation platforms
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": for example Ansible
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": or GitOps platforms
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig2": such as ArgoCD. When a manifest is pulled from a version control system without tag or commit Secure Hash Algorithm (SHA) specified
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig3": it is pulled from the HEAD revision
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_1": which is equal to the 'latest' tag
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_2": and pulls the last change made. This increases the risk of encountering a new
"ssphp.use_case.framework.ig_3": potentially malicious configuration. If an attacker pushes malicious configuration to the version control system
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.document.name": the next user who pulls the HEAD revision will pull it and risk attack. To avoid that risk
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.document.version": use a version tag of verified version or a commit SHA of a trusted commit
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.document.date": which will ensure this is the only version pulled."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.version": "Changes in deployment configuration will not be pulled unless their version tag or commit Secure Hash Algorithm (SHA) is specified. This might slow down the deployment process."
"ssphp.metadata.last_updated_date": "4.1 Establish and Maintain a Secure Configuration Process"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure deployments are automated"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Automate deployments of production environment and application."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "Automating the deployments of both production environment and applications reduces the risk for human mistakes - such as a wrong configuration or exposure of sensitive data - because it requires less human interaction or intervention. It also eases redeployment of the environment. It is best to automate with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) because it offers more control over changes made to the environment creation configuration and stores to a version control platform."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": "Deployment"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": "16.7 Use Standard Hardening Configuration Templates for Application Infrastructure"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": "FALSE"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure the deployment environment is reproducible"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Verify that the deployment environment - the orchestrator and the production environment where the application is deployed - is reproducible. This means that the environment stays the same in each deployment if the configuration has not changed."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "A reproducible build is a build that produces the same artifact when given the same input data
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": and in this case the same environment. Ensuring that the same environment is produced when given the same input helps verify that no change has been made to it. This action allows an organization to trust that its deployment environment is built only from safe code and configuration that has been reviewed and tested and has not been tainted or changed abruptly."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": "Deployment"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": "16.7 Use Standard Hardening Configuration Templates for Application Infrastructure"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure access to production environment is limited"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Restrict access to the production environment to a few trusted and qualified users only."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "The production environment is an extremely sensitive one. It directly affects the customer experience and trust in a product
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.impact": which has serious effects on the organization itself. Because of this sensitive nature
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": it is important to restrict access to the production environment to only a few trusted and qualified users. This will reduce the risk of mistakes such as exposure of secrets or misconfiguration. This restriction also reduces the number of accounts that are vulnerable to hijacking in order to potentially harm the production environment."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": "Reducing the number of users who have access to the production environment means those users would lose their ability to make direct changes to that environment."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": "Deployment"

"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.title": "Ensure default passwords are not used"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.descriptio: "Do not use default passwords of deployment tools and components."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.rationale": "Many deployment tools and components are provided with default passwords for the first login. This password is intended to be used only on the first login and should be changed immediately after. Using the default password substantially increases the attack risk. It is very important to ensure that default passwords are not used in deployment tools and components."
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.control.group": "Deployment"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.v8": "5.2 Use Unique Passwords"
"ssphp.cis_benchmark.controls.ig1": "TRUE"
